intro: Nasturtium morisonii, commonly known as the Morison's nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Tropaeolaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often used in ornamental gardening. Its edible flowers and leaves are also appreciated in culinary applications.
